Now, before we do our pie-based

in circles and why pi
so important.

Now to do that because we're in

SPEAKER 1: There's a giant

So this circle here, as you can
see, there's two things
going on with the circle.

First of all, there
is the diameter.

So it's this nice, wonderful
straight line here that goes

right through the middle

And the great thing about
diameter is it's a nice
straight line.

So if I wanted to, I could get
a measuring tape, and I could

measure from the start all the

and get a very precise

Now around here, we have
the circumference.

Now this is a lot harder

As you can see, it's
a curved line.

So instead of having
to measure it
directly, we can use pi.

Now pi is the ratio of the
straight line diameter to the

total distance all the way
around the outside.

And if we know that ratio, we

diameter, multiply it by pi, and
get the exact distance all
the way around the outside.

All right, enough messing around

All right, first thing
